result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A Bonich III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald A Bonich III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald A Bonich III was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Ronald A Bonich III was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 60 days to pay, failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25.00 owed.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant re: payment plan request and Mid-Moraine warrant

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald A Bonich III  PROVIDED BY DEFENDANT VIA CORRESPONDENCE
Current: 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: 2039 S Main St #1, West Bend, WI 53095
From defendant re: fines owed and payment plan upon release 8/29/2017

Down payment received as well as payment plan arranged for balance

Copy emailed to Sheriff's Dept.  Corporal Gahan will teletype the WSP.

Defendant Ronald A Bonich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 3.  Count 2 dismissed by the State.  Court finds defendant guilty and renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ronald A Bonich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment for disposition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on August 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Ronald A Bonich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.  Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Ronald A Bonich in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant and/or counsel requests matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Conditions set by court:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers. No contact with codefendant J.L. No contact with any Home Depot.

Defendant Ronald A Bonich in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time.  Waive reading of felony complaint. State believes def is now on probation hold. State requests $25000 cash bail with conditions.  Attorney needs to speak with defendant in future if he requests public defender counsel.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
